article.text: Huge thanks to camera.com.sg for making this Madventure 360 review possible.

Very often, we spend so much time framing our shots that we miss the best moment to take a photo. There also times when the objects are so huge, we can’t fit them into our camera’s narrow field of view. What if you can capture everything around you, then crop later?
If these issues frustrate you, the Madventure 360 by MADV might be the solution for you. I brought one with me on my recent trip to Hainan and had lots of fun with it. Here is my review!
Design & Accessories – Great Stuff!

You may have noticed that Madventure 360 looks a lot like Mi Sphere Camera. No, it isn’t a clone. It is the 360° action camera equivalent of 1MORE headphones, the superior version of the Mi Sphere Camera.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg1.jpg?alt=media&token=2599de42-09e4-4247-881b-a6797f3fb6f8

There are 2 cameras on this thing with ultra wide-angle lens, one in front and another behind. Powering it on, two icons will light up on one of the sides. These lights shows what mode you are in: camera or video. There is another icon that lights up when it runs out of battery or when charging.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg2.jpg?alt=media&token=413e4120-8445-48d7-85bc-6e588997e905
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg3.jpg?alt=media&token=face4446-2d5d-4734-8489-b2d7b994e384

On top, there are 2 microphone holes and 3 buttons. A long press on the left-most button powers the device on/off and a short press switches modes. Beside that, we have a wireless button to enable connection to the app. Lastly, we have a capture/record button on the right, indicated by a red dot.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg4.jpg?alt=media&token=090990d3-6ae0-4787-973d-36db9f27aa10

On the left side is a flap. Underneath, you will find a MicroSD card slot and a micro USB port for charging. Note that there isn’t any internal storage, so you will need to get a MicroSD card to use this thing.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg5.jpg?alt=media&token=ecb2d6db-4602-4d4f-97e1-ed9795e82fc2

On the bottom, we have a 1/4″ screw hole for your tripod, as well as 2 metal pins that are used for the selfie stick included in the box. These pins allow the shutter button on the stick to work without needing Bluetooth. The stick has a nice rubber grip and can extent quite a bit.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg6.jpg?alt=media&token=4a22d992-c871-4eff-9f36-088eb4abbe91
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg7.jpg?alt=media&token=31478b62-8661-4638-8839-17c07932726c

There are more accessories in the box, includes a GoPro mount adapter, a mini tripod stand and a nice carrying pouch. I wish that MADV had included a tripod hole on the selfie stick, so that it can be used with the mini tripod. Right now, you can only use one or the other.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg8.jpg?alt=media&token=fbb07a4b-e489-4718-8a35-c28074d0daea
Mobile & PC App – Can be Improved

MADV’s Madventure 360 app is available on both App Store and Play Store. You can use the Madventure 360 without the app; all the basic stuff can be done on the camera itself. But to view photos/videos you took and for more complex features, you will want to download it.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg9.jpg?alt=media&token=f3c748d3-2ca8-44b4-a483-c63da8996cb5

To connect, press the wireless button on the camera, then wait for the white LED light to turn on and stop blinking. Now, go into WiFi settings on your phone and look for the camera. Once connected, go back into the app and press on the orange camera icon below.
In the app, we get access to the viewfinder and more settings for the camera. You also get access to more modes in the app, like slow motion and timelapse, as well as manual controls.
Using the mobile app to export all your images and videos can be slow and troublesome when you have too many of them. This is when you will want to use the Madventure 360 PC software.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg10.jpg?alt=media&token=681fbd2e-534d-4074-b2c4-c9007e8a2cba
You can also view and download images/videos to your phone, then export them in various forms to share them: little planet, pano, mirror ball, etc…
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg11.jpg?alt=media&token=16e5bf5b-8481-4da0-954a-43b34e66f91d

Opening the images/videos on your computer, they appear as two circles and you can see parts of the camera at the borders. This is the unstitched version. To turn them into proper 360° content, you will need to transcode them in the app. This takes a really long time.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg12.jpg?alt=media&token=d6b4e5f7-247c-4191-8550-b19bfe94cec8
*Note that the full res video files are those with AA in their file names.
Sadly, that is all this software is able to do. No editing of your 360° content. Also, it isn’t very user friendly; drag and drop does not work and you can’t view the exported file from the app.
360° Photos – Perfect for Travel Selfies

As mentioned at the start, I took it with me on my trip to Hainan recently. Being able to capture 360°, there is not need to worry about the subject not being in frame. So instead of spending a lot of time framing my shots, I just took the camera out and pressed the shutter button to capture.

This also meant that I was less reliant on the app; I only used it to save the photos to my phone. In fact, I never touched the manual controls as I found them to be counter intuitive. Why spend so much time on getting a “perfect” photo when the purpose of this camera is to capture the best moment?

Madventure does a great job at stitching the 360° photo together, though there are times where it screws up a little. That said, its stitching is still way better than taking panoramic photos with your smartphone, as you can see in the photo comparison below.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg13.jpeg?alt=media&token=249ab700-72bd-4b37-ba91-2bb357181d38

https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg21.jpg?alt=media&token=ce9bdb1b-f092-46ca-8a50-6b3758772446
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg22.jpg?alt=media&token=3081b101-edd4-4dfe-bc89-516f4bc963ac
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg23.jpg?alt=media&token=c55e637a-b747-4f2b-9f0a-b335a5c61e2e
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg24.jpg?alt=media&token=fc596d33-c7a6-4a82-9fdf-008bc7a1e19a

A 360° camera like the Madventure 360 is great for taking selfies as you are always in the frame. However, it isn’t suitable for taking photos of far objects as they will appear really small. That is when you will want to use your smartphone’s camera to take a photo.
360° Videos – Even Better!

If you thought the photos are impressive, take a look at the video that the Madventure 360 can record. Below is a video montage of my trip to Hainan. Even at night, when most cameras struggle, the Madventure 360 does a superb job with great level of details and well controlled noise.
https://www.youtube.com/embed/cph8kwNoKho
The microphone sounds surprisingly decent, as long as there isn’t strong wind.
https://www.youtube.com/embed/LyJ-pOyJGuY
As the camera records at 4K, file sizes of videos are huge. A 10s video easily exceeds 50MB. I highly recommend using a MicroSD card of at least 32GB storage.
Battery – Close to 2 Days of Casual Use

Occasionally turning on to snap a photo or record a short video, I was able to use it for close to 2 days on a single charge. If you record videos for long periods, expect the battery life to be a lot shorter. Battery is non-removable. On the plus side, you can use it while charging.
Price – Is Madventure 360 Worth It?
Priced at S$469 regularly (S$399 now!), the Madventure 360 isn’t exactly affordable. Is the Madventure 360 worth that much? Are 360° cameras even worth your money?
If you are getting it purely to capture 360° content, my answer is no. Many social media platforms do not support 360° content yet, though Facebook is one of the few that do.
https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/logicui-9667a.appspot.com/o/reviews%2Fmadv-madventure-360-review%2Fimg26.jpg?alt=media&token=0d8e1f04-c4df-4c0e-8c05-723baee6f63c

But if you can afford it, travel often and love taking selfies, consider getting one. It lets you to take selfies without worrying about framing your shot. I really enjoyed using it on my trip to Hainan and was considering buying one. The only thing stopping me is that hefty price tag.
Future Improvements
Here are a few improvements I would like to see in the next version of Madventure 360.
Firstly, I would like the ability to view 360 ° content that downloaded on my phone, without having to connect the camera. Right now, the app refuses to show anything if I don’t connect the camera.
Secondly, I hope to see the Madventure 360 PC software become more user friendly and crash less often. Also, it would be really nice if MADV can include a 360° editing suite as well.

Next, it would be awesome if MADV can add a tripod hole to the selfie stick. Or better, make the selfie stick and mini tripod one piece. Fewer loose parts to bring around = less likely to loose something.

Lastly, the camera beeps every time you press a button, but all the beeps are the same. I wish that there are different beeps for different actions. E.g. short beep for start recording, long beep for stop recording. This would really aid the user under very bright environments.
